required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Immunogenicity (Non-inferiority) of a Purified Chick Embryo Cell Vaccine Vaccine Administered in Two Different Schedules (Conventional Versus Abbreviated Schedule)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Single Center, Randomized, Open-label Study, Comparing PCECV Administered in the Abbreviated Zagreb Regimen (2-1-1) to the Conventional Essen Regimen (1-1-1-1-1) in Healthy Volunteers in China

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigates the safety and immunogenicity (non-inferiority) of a Purified Chick Embryo Cell Vaccine (PCECV) administered in two different schedules (conventional versus abbreviated schedule) in healthy adults 18 to 50 years of age in China

primary_outcome.measure: Rabies Virus Neutralizing Antibody Concentrations on Day 14.
primary_outcome.description: Rabies virus neutralizing antibody concentrations of the abbreviated Zagreb regimen compared with the conventional Essen regimen. Results are presented on log2 scale. For results on original geometric (multiplicative) scale please raise numbers to the basis of 2.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Reported a Local or Systemic Reaction After Any Vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Specified local and systemic reactions were solicited for 7 days after each vaccination. Number of participants were calculated who reported a local or systemic reaction after any of the vaccinations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rabies Virus Neutralizing Antibody Concentrations on Day 7 and Day 42.
secondary_outcome.description: Rabies virus neutralizing antibody concentrations the abbreviated Zagreb regimen compared with the conventional Essen regimen. Results are presented on log2 scale. For results on original geometric (multiplicative) scale please raise numbers to the basis of 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Participants With Seroconversion (Rabies Virus Neutralizing Antibody Concentrations Equal and Above 0.5 IU/ml) on Days 7, 14 and 42.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of participants with seroconversion (defined as rabies virus neutralizing antibody concentrations equal and above 0.5 IU/ml) on days 7, 14 and 42.

arm_group.description: Rabies PCEC vaccine was applied according Zagreb schedule with 2 vaccinations on day 0, 1 vaccination on day 7 and day 21, respectively
Rabies PCEC vaccine was applied according Essen schedule, i.e. 1 vaccination on day 0, day 3, day 7, day 14 and day 28, respectively.

intervention.description: Subjects received the abbreviated Zagreb 2-1-1 schedule in a safety-lead-in phase.
intervention.other_name: PCEC Rabies vaccine for human use

intervention.description: Subjects received the standard Essen regimen.
intervention.other_name: PCEC Rabies vaccine for human use

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study participants were enrolled in November 2008 at 1 center in China.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All enrolled subjects were randomized, but one subject in the Zagreb (2-1-1) group was not vaccinated.

group.title: Abbreviated Zagreb (2-1-1)
group.description: Abbreviated Zagreb vaccination schedule with 2 vaccinations at day 0, 1 vaccination at day 7 and 1 vaccination at day 21.

group.title: Conventional Essen(1-1-1-1-1)
group.description: Conventional Essen schedule with 1 vaccination on day 0, day 3, day 7, day 14 and day 28, respectively.

group.title: Abbreviated Zagreb (2-1-1)
group.description: Abbreviated Zagreb vaccination schedule with 2 vaccinations at day 0, 1 vaccination at day 7 and 1 vaccination at day 21.

group.title: Conventional Essen(1-1-1-1-1)
group.description: Conventional Essen schedule with 1 vaccination on day 0, day 3, day 7, day 14 and day 28, respectively.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Baseline measures are presented for safety population.

measure.title: Gender
measure.description: Baseline measures are presented for safety population.

outcome.title: Rabies Virus Neutralizing Antibody Concentrations on Day 14.
outcome.description: Rabies virus neutralizing antibody concentrations of the abbreviated Zagreb regimen compared with the conventional Essen regimen. Results are presented on log2 scale. For results on original geometric (multiplicative) scale please raise numbers to the basis of 2.
outcome.population: Due to the Chinese registration requirements, only a subset of subjects bloodsamples were drawn and immunogenicity was evaluated. The per protocol population of this subset was analyzed.

group.title: Abbreviated Zagreb (2-1-1)
group.description: Abbreviated Zagreb vaccination schedule with 2 vaccinations at day 0, 1 vaccination at day 7 and 1 vaccination at day 21.

group.title: Conventional Essen(1-1-1-1-1)
group.description: Conventional Essen schedule with 1 vaccination on day 0, day 3, day 7, day 14 and day 28, respectively.

measure.title: Rabies Virus Neutralizing Antibody Concentrations on Day 14.
measure.description: Rabies virus neutralizing antibody concentrations of the abbreviated Zagreb regimen compared with the conventional Essen regimen. Results are presented on log2 scale. For results on original geometric (multiplicative) scale please raise numbers to the basis of 2.
measure.population: Due to the Chinese registration requirements, only a subset of subjects bloodsamples were drawn and immunogenicity was evaluated. The per protocol population of this subset was analyzed.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The null hypothesis states that the Zagreb schedule is inferior to the Essen schedule in terms of day 14 antibody titers assuming no difference between the two schedules and the equivalence limit of 1.5 titer levels (log2).
analysis.estimate_desc: Ratio of log2 mean (Zagreb/Essen) on day 14

outcome.title: Rabies Virus Neutralizing Antibody Concentrations on Day 7 and Day 42.
outcome.description: Rabies virus neutralizing antibody concentrations the abbreviated Zagreb regimen compared with the conventional Essen regimen. Results are presented on log2 scale. For results on original geometric (multiplicative) scale please raise numbers to the basis of 2.
outcome.population: Due to the Chinese registration requirements, only a subset of subjects bloodsamples were drawn and immunogenicity was evaluated. The per protocol population of this subset was analyzed.

measure.population: Due to the Chinese registration requirements, only a subset of subjects bloodsamples were drawn and immunogenicity was evaluated. The per protocol population of this subset was analyzed.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The null hypothesis states that the Zagreb schedule is inferior to the Essen schedule in terms of day 7 antibody titers assuming no difference between the two schedules and the equivalence limit of 1.5 titer levels (log2).
analysis.estimate_desc: Ratio of log2 means (Zagreb/Essen) on day 7

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The null hypothesis states that the Zagreb schedule is inferior to the Essen schedule in terms of day 42 antibody titers assuming no difference between the two schedules and the equivalence limit of 1.5 titer levels (log2).
analysis.estimate_desc: Ratio of log2 mean (Zagreb/(Essen) on day 42

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Reported a Local or Systemic Reaction After Any Vaccination
outcome.description: Specified local and systemic reactions were solicited for 7 days after each vaccination. Number of participants were calculated who reported a local or systemic reaction after any of the vaccinations.
outcome.population: Safety was analyzed for the safety set. One enrolled subject was not vaccinated and not included in the safety set because of inappropriate inclusion.

reported_events.time_frame: Any unsolicited adverse events were collected for 7 days after each vaccination, all serious adverse events were collected throughout the whole study period (beyond individual study participation, from 12 Nov 2008 to 12 Jan 2009).
reported_events.desc: Subjects were instructed to report on a daily basis any adverse events and record them on a diary card.

group.title: Abbreviated Zagreb (2-1-1)
group.description: Abbreviated Zagreb vaccination schedule with 2 vaccinations at day 0, 1 vaccination at day 7 and 1 vaccination at day 21.

group.title: Conventional Essen(1-1-1-1-1)
group.description: Conventional Essen schedule with 1 vaccination on day 0, day 3, day 7, day 14 and day 28, respectively.

event.sub_title: Injury of soft tissue in the leg and shoulder
event.description: Safety was analyzed for the safety set. One enrolled subject in the abbreviated Zaghreb group was not vaccinated and not included in the safety set, because of inappropriate inclusion.
Safety was analyzed for the safety set. One enrolled subject in the abbreviated Zaghreb group was not vaccinated and not included in the safety set, because of inappropriate inclusion.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
